actor_awards.notes: A suave French actor known for his charm and elegance, he gained Hollywood fame in 'Gigi' and later as the villain in the James Bond film 'Octopussy'. He was a Chevalier of the Legion of Honour.

filmography.title: Gigi
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, bored playboy in Paris who finds himself falling in love with the granddaughter of his mistress's old friend.
filmography.plot: Weary of the conventions of Parisian society, a rich playboy and a youthful courtesan-in-training enjoy a platonic friendship, but it may not stay platonic for long.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Octopussy
filmography.role_description: An exiled Afghan prince and smuggler who partners with a Soviet general to detonate a nuclear weapon in Europe.
filmography.plot: James Bond uncovers an international jewel-smuggling operation, headed by the mysterious Octopussy, being used to disguise a nuclear attack on N.A.T.O. forces.

filmography.title: Letter from an Unknown Woman
filmography.role_description: A talented but dissolute pianist who unknowingly becomes the lifelong obsession of a young woman.
filmography.plot: A pianist about to flee from a duel receives a letter from a woman he cannot remember, who may have held the key to his life.

filmography.title: The Paradine Case
filmography.role_description: The mysterious valet to a murdered blind man, whose relationship with the victim's wife is central to the trial.
filmography.plot: A married lawyer falls in love with the woman he is defending against a murder charge.

filmography.title: Madame Bovary
filmography.role_description: A dashing aristocrat who engages in a passionate affair with the bored housewife Emma Bovary.
filmography.plot: The bored wife of a country doctor seeks to escape the banality of her life through affairs and overspending.

filmography.title: Three Coins in the Fountain
filmography.role_description: An Italian prince who charms one of the three American women seeking romance in Rome.
filmography.plot: Three American women working in Rome share a spacious apartment and the desire to find romance.

filmography.title: The Swan
filmography.role_description: A handsome tutor who falls in love with a princess who is being groomed to marry a crown prince.
filmography.plot: A princess is urged by her mother to marry a crown prince, but her heart belongs to the family tutor.

filmography.title: Julie
filmography.role_description: A jealous and possessive husband who terrorizes his wife, forcing her to flee for her life.
filmography.plot: A flight attendant is terrorized by her jealousy-crazed husband, a concert pianist who may have murdered her first husband.

filmography.title: Can-Can
filmography.role_description: A strait-laced judge who investigates a dance hall but ends up falling for the owner.
filmography.plot: In 1896 Paris, a café owner defies the ban on the Can-Can dance while juggling the affections of a judge and a lawyer.

filmography.title: The V.I.P.s
filmography.role_description: A gigolo planning to run away with the wife of a wealthy industrialist.
filmography.plot: A group of passengers is stranded at a London airport by fog, causing high-stakes personal dramas to unfold.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Margaret Rutherford)

filmography.title: Swamp Thing
filmography.role_description: A mad scientist obsessed with immortality who creates the Swamp Thing through a lab accident.
filmography.plot: After a violent incident with a special chemical, a research scientist is turned into a swamp plant monster.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nomination – Best Horror Film

filmography.title: The Return of Swamp Thing
filmography.role_description: The villain returns to continue his genetic experiments and battle the Swamp Thing once more.
filmography.plot: The Swamp Thing returns to battle the evil Dr. Arcane, who has a new plan to create a race of genetic monsters.

filmography.title: Anne of the Indies
filmography.role_description: A French naval officer who is captured by a female pirate and becomes the object of her affection.
filmography.plot: A female pirate captain spares a handsome Frenchman from walking the plank, only to find he is not who he seems.

filmography.title: Bird of Paradise
filmography.role_description: A Frenchman who travels to a South Seas island and falls in love with the chief's daughter.
filmography.plot: A young Frenchman visits a Polynesian island and falls in love with the chief's daughter, triggering a clash of cultures.

filmography.title: The Happy Time
filmography.role_description: The Casanova-like uncle in a French-Canadian family who influences his young nephew.
filmography.plot: A French-Canadian family in 1920s Ottawa deals with the coming-of-age of their youngest son and the antics of his eccentric uncles.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture - Drama

filmography.title: No Minor Vices
filmography.role_description: An eccentric artist who disrupts the lives of a pediatrician and his wife.
filmography.plot: A successful pediatrician's orderly life is turned upside down when he invites a bohemian artist into his home.

filmography.title: The Best of Everything
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated theater director who becomes involved with an ambitious young editor.
filmography.plot: An expose of the lives and loves of three young women sharing an apartment in New York City while working at a publishing house.

filmography.title: Made in Paris
filmography.role_description: A famous French fashion designer whom an American buyer must negotiate with.
filmography.plot: An American fashion buyer travels to Paris for work and is pursued by three different men.

filmography.title: A Flea in Her Ear
filmography.role_description: A character in this farce about mistaken identities and marital suspicions.
filmography.plot: A woman suspects her husband of infidelity and sets a trap for him at a hotel, leading to chaos.

filmography.title: Year of the Comet
filmography.role_description: A suave villain involved in the pursuit of a rare bottle of wine. This was Jourdan's final film role.
filmography.plot: A shy wine taster discovers a rare bottle of wine and gets caught up in an international caper to protect it.

filmography.title: Count Dracula
filmography.role_description: A faithful adaptation of the vampire count in this BBC television production.
filmography.plot: Count Dracula travels from Transylvania to England to find fresh blood and spread his undead curse.

filmography.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
filmography.role_description: The ambitious prosecutor who unjustly imprisons Edmond Dantès to protect his own career.
filmography.plot: A young man, falsely imprisoned by his jealous "friends," escapes and uses a hidden treasure to exact his revenge.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Outstanding Lead Actor (Richard Chamberlain)

filmography.title: The Man in the Iron Mask
filmography.role_description: The aging captain of the musketeers who must choose between duty to his king and doing what is right.
filmography.plot: The Musketeers rescue the imprisoned twin brother of King Louis XIV to replace the corrupt monarch.

filmography.title: Silver Bears
filmography.role_description: An impoverished Italian prince who gets involved in a complex financial scheme involving silver mines.
filmography.plot: A mob boss sends his accountant to Switzerland to buy a bank in order to launder illegal profits.

filmography.title: Columbo: Murder Under Glass
filmography.role_description: A famous restaurant critic who murders a restaurant owner to protect a kickback scheme.
filmography.plot: Lieutenant Columbo investigates the poisoning of a restaurant owner, suspecting a powerful food critic.

filmography.title: Decameron Nights
filmography.role: Giovanni Boccaccio / Paganino / Giulio / Don Bertrando
filmography.role_description: Jourdan plays multiple roles in this anthology film based on Boccaccio's tales.
filmography.plot: A storyteller recounts three tales of love and seduction to win the hand of a noblewoman.
